name: Inn at Depot Hill

reviews.title: Great location and lovely setting
reviews.text: I just spent two nights at the Inn at Depot Hill and highly recommend it. The location is wonderful for visiting Capitola, the Inn is very attractive, the rooms were lovely and the food was very good.

The Inn at Depot Hill is even better than the beautiful online representation. The rooms are sumptous and quiet, each completely different from the next with wonderful, soft, comfy, cozy furnishings. We stayed in the Costa Del Sol room with a king size feather bed that was romantic and snuggly all at the same time. The fireplace, double shower, fresh flowers, and deck are just a few of the amenities the room afforded. The staff was excellent, curteous and warm, knowledgable about the area and made us feel as if we were special, very good attention to detail. The food! Yum! The best croissants, ever! Breakfast, appetizers, and desert every day. We are going back in June. This was the best B & B we have ever stayed at. I highly recommend it.
reviews.title: We Loved It!

reviews.text: I stayed here last February! I arrived around 11PM and was warmly greeted with little munchies and wine. We had a nice little room with a small upstairs area and a electronic fireplace, we also had a small library to ourselves. It's a nice place, a pleasant walk to the small downtown area of Capitola with little shops & such. We were made a nice breakfast and they had warm hospitality. We were able to see almost all of the rooms and they are all extremely well decorated, each with a different theme. Oh but also my only complaint was a strange smell in the room probably from the fireplace.
reviews.title: Charming little place!
Time for updating and..........
reviews.text: The Inn has definitely seen better days. The wallpaper is looking very worn in obvious places, the marble shower tile had stains, the drapes were dingy, and the bedspread was disgusting, quite frankly. ( If there are stains on a bedspread, clean it or replace it.) Two of the white towels in our room had yellow stains on them. Hopefully, someone threw them out or at least added bleach to the wash, as you would do at home. The tv was very small with only a vcr option. The drinking glasses in our room looked very filmy; probably just wiped out once in awhile. Ironically, the paper in a frame that offers hotel service was stained. How can the owners miss all of this? It's a shame to see the Depot neglected to save a few dollars!
What a superb beginning to our drive down the coast! The only downside to staying here was that it set the bar so high for our following stops.
reviews.title: A Great Way to Start Our Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My spouse and I stayed at the Inn at Depot Hill for four nights while in Santa Cruz for our annual extended family vacation. We had 18 people in an absolutely gorgeous rented villa in Aptos overlooking the ocean, but there was regrettably no room for us. To make ourselves feel better we "splurged" and booked the Kyoto Room at the Inn. Our strategy worked. Despite the fact that the rental house was akin to Hearst Castle, we never felt sorry for ourselves. We actually preferred our room in the back of the Inn with a private Zen garden. I won't repeat what everyone else has said about the Inn's marvelous attention to detail, the stunning breakfasts, wine and hors d’oeuvres each afternoon, etc. We especially enjoyed returning from our relatives each evening and raiding the refrigerator for desert - cheesecake, fruit tarts, unbelievably scrumptious. The person who owns Inns by the Sea is to be praised on every management level. Something must be seriously flawed with Trip Advisor's rating system that this is rated the #2 B&B in Capitola.
reviews.title: Superb doesn't do it justice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have travelled extensively, both locally and abroad and have yet to stay in a B&B that provides such an accommodating welcome, consistent attention to needs, when they arise, and an overall attitude from the staff of quiet graciousness. The breakfasts are among some of the best I have had ,be they hotels or restaurants, and the room service appointments are fresh and elegant.
reviews.title: Best B&B I have ever stayed at

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Over the past 10 years or more, when I travel to Santa Cruz, I make a point of securing a reservation at The Inn at Depot Hill, so I really can attest to their consistency at every level, and I have never been dissapointed.
reviews.title: Romantic get-away at a beautiful inn in Capitola, CA

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have also had the good fortune of having stayed in all but one of their rooms and my husband and I have delighted in each one.
reviews.title: Very romantic and peaceful atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Keep up the good work and awesome kudos to the current manager, she is the best.
reviews.title: A dowager in need of a face lift.

likes.disliked: — mysterious light switches, lack of landscaping around patios

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 4 nights in the Delft Room. The room was large, clean and very lovely. There were French Doors leading to a small, enclosed patio that had a table and chairs as well as a hot tub. The bed was very comfortable. In the evenings we would light a fire in the fireplace. Because of the Inn's proximity to Capitola there is some street noise at night but we were not bothered with noise from the other rooms.The staff is very solicitous. They made every effort to assist us with excursion during the day and dinner suggestions and reservations. They provided an excellent breakfast in the mornings as well as appetizers in the early evening and desserts after 7:00. There is a large courtyard that has a little pond and several large tables and chairs. We spent several hours sitting outside and enjoying the sun and reading books. The management of the Inn obviously cares about serving it's guests with style and grace. It may be a small Inn but in knows how to make a big impression.
reviews.title: Little Inn With A Big Heart

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to the Inn at Depot Hill to celebrate my boyfriend's 30th birthday. I was a little hesitant at first just becasue we have never stayed at a Bed&Breakfast before. I am typically more drawn to larger, more modern hotels. However we wanted to try something different, and the price was right, so we gave it a shot. I am VERY glad we did.
reviews.title: The Inn at Depot Hill

likes.disliked: — the lack of privacy on our back patio

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Inn at Depot Hill is quaint and cozy. It doesn't look like much when you first pull up but it is bright and airy inside and the rooms are very cute and comfortable. Our host gave us the quick run down and then showed us to our room, the Sissinghurst room. I loved the pretty fabrics (they were very floral so not my boyfriend's taste, but they were perfect for the English theme). it was great to have our own fireplace in our room. We got the romance package so when we checked in to our room they gave us Champagne and truffles. We sat by our fireplace and drank and tried the appetizers...it was so relaxing!
reviews.title: Great escape at Inn at Depot Hill!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best part of our room was 100% the bed! I wish it was king size but it didnt even matter because it was so amazingly comfortable! It was like sleeping on a cloud! We loved it.
reviews.title: Wonderful Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortuantely I have to point out a couple things I didn't love so much. I think the gardening / landscaping could use some work. The website described our patio as an "English Garden" but in reality it was pretty plain...just some bricks and old ivy. Also, our room had a "private" 2 person tub out on the patio. It was kind of awkward looking. It's enclosed in strange wooden gazebo-ish structure that looks like its falling apart a bit. There was a staircase to the other building of the Inn that went right behind our patio so when people walked up the stairs to their room, they could see right over the fence onto our patio....so much for being private :(
reviews.title: Fantastic!

likes.liked: — The service, the food, the rooms - fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were looking for somewhere to stay near UC Santa Cruz to visit my little brother the college student. Luxury accomodations in the area are poor overall, but the reviews about the Inn were amazing and we had high expectations. Our room was on the top floor, the pacifica room. The room was large and bathroom had an over-sized dual-head shower. The bed, sheets, towels, robes, and pillows were good and the room was quiet overall. Loved that fireplace.
reviews.title: 3 star accomodations near UC Santa Cruz and Pricey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The inn is dated and needs caulking and paint. The shower heads were standard with no temperature control, so guess what during those dual shower head showers, the temperature changed. The TV was a joke, 9 inches with VHS, give me a break. We were watching movies on my 17 inch lap top. Now a days, everyone has flat panel LCD. The free WI-FI sucked, they really need to add more stations or boosters. There was no way to control the temperature in the room.
reviews.title: Best B&B we've ever visited

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The after dinner desserts, coffee, and wine from 7-10 pm was great, blueberry and apple cobbler or cheesecake Although the living area furniture is not the most comfortable. The dining seating is fine. The breakfasts were OK, preset menus, e.g. eggs benedict on Sunday, premade artichoke and over herbed fritata on Monday. You would expect more for 4 stars.
reviews.title: Almost Perfect, But Not Quite

reviews.text: The staff was professional and hey it is a job.
reviews.title: What a wonderful stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, they let kids come here, so if you are planning for some quiet time at breakfast or dinner, forget it, there was a 3 year old climbing on everything and a baby crying,YECH!
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience at Depot Hill

aka: Inn At Depot Hill Hotel Capitola
description: Near the beach in the quaint, Mediterranean-style resort of Capitola-by-the-Sea, this AAA 4-diamond rated inn boasts 12 uniquely designed guest rooms and suites, each with its own fireplace, and many featuring private patios with hot tubs. Guests enjoy a full gourmet breakfast each morning served in the main salon or delivered right to your room. Enjoy afternoon wine and hors d'oeuvres, and our delicious homemade desert in the evening.
